title: myJpackage Introduction
text: Just Another Gibbs Sampler better known JAGS program Bayesian graphical model analyses using Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) simulation. JAGS aims compatibility classic BUGS, Bayesian inference Using Gibbs Sampling, software R. several packages run JAGS using R, however still need code within BUGS programming language. package aims help understand basic structure JAGS models data specification, can use output code functions package create using output helper coding.

what: Examples of data transformation uses within the JAGS code. — jags_data
title: Examples of data transformation uses within the JAGS code. — jags_data
text: jags_data() prints examples can passed data block within JAGS code. data generated can also specified  particular following model, creating data string model specification.

title: Examples of data transformation uses within the JAGS code. — jags_data
Examples of data transformation uses within the JAGS code. — jags_data
text: block Character string indicating data generation method transformation applied input data.

title: Examples of data transformation uses within the JAGS code. — jags_data
text: Transformation Available transformations "sqrt", "log", "exp", "sqr". Also "dim" can used argument. latter useful dimension response vector need previously specified. Simulated data Using "prior" generates true values parameters mu tau given prior specified data block. means mu tau generated passed model. Using "fix" print code mu tau data model block. means parameters taken observed values model.

title: Examples of data transformation uses within the JAGS code. — jags_data
code: jags_data(block = "sqrt") #> data { #>   for (i in 1:N) { #>     y[i] <- sqrt(x[i]) #>   } #> } #>  jags_data(block = "fix") #> data { #>   for (i in 1:N) { #>     y[i] ~ dnorm(mu, tau) #>   } #>   mu ~ dnorm(0,1); #>   tau ~ dgamma(1,3); #> } #> model { #>   for (i in 1:N) { #>     y[i] ~ dnorm(mu, tau) #>   } #>   mu ~ dnorm(0, 1.0E-3) #>   tau ~ dgamma(1.0E-3, 1.0E-3) #> } #>

what: Coded examples of JAGS models and R runs. — jags_examples
title: Coded examples of JAGS models and R runs. — jags_examples
text: jags_examples() gives example code JAGS model specification, code passed run.jags function.

title: Coded examples of JAGS models and R runs. — jags_examples
Coded examples of JAGS models and R runs. — jags_examples
text: example Character string. Prints example models using JAGS specific code parametrization. Options "model1" "model2. runme Logical. TRUE R code run JAGS model also displayed. default value runme = TRUE.

title: Coded examples of JAGS models and R runs. — jags_examples
text: example model 1 logistic regression Bernoulli random variable. Linearity eta, b normal prior distributions. model 2 logarithmic regression Poisson random variable. runme

title: Coded examples of JAGS models and R runs. — jags_examples
code: jags_examples("model1") #> model1 <- "model { #>   for (i in 1:N) { #>     eta[i] <- a + b * x[i] #>     logit(prob[i]) <- eta[i] #>     y[i] ~ dbern(prob[i]) #>   } #>   a ~ dnorm(0, 0.01) #>   b ~ dnorm(0, 0.01) #> }" #> n <- 100 #> x <- rnorm(n) #> eta <-  1 + x #> prob <- 1/(1+exp(-eta)) #> y <- rbinom(n, size = 1, prob = prob) #> library(runjags) #> r <- combine.mcmc(run.jags(model = model1, #>                            data = list(y = y, x = x, N = n), #>                            monitor = c("prob[1]", "a",  "b"), #>                            n.chains = 4, #>                            sample = 10^5, #>                            method = "parallel")) #> summary(r) #>

Installation steps may vary depending whether Mac OS X, Linux Windows used. Note packages can used instead , complimentary , runjags.

what: Returns JAGS code for an specific model — jags_model
title: Returns JAGS code for an specific model — jags_model
text: jags_model() prints code needed model specification using JAGS. models distribution options quite general, user can grasp structure code. However, models widely used without added complexity. Note JAGS accepts wide range distributions likelihood parameter.

title: Returns JAGS code for an specific model — jags_model
code: jags_model(likelihood, regression, param = F, reg = F)

title: Returns JAGS code for an specific model — jags_model
text: likelihood Likelihood function. accepts "dnorm", "dbinom", "dpois", "dbern". regression function accepting "linear", "logit", "log" part likelihood specification. param Logical FALSE default option. TRUE, prior distribution previously specified character string using parameters regression argument. FALSE, prior distribution assumed normal. reg Logical FALSE default option. accepts TRUE value regression = "linear", prints formula mean variance.

title: Returns JAGS code for an specific model — jags_model
code: jags_model("dnorm", "linear", param = FALSE, reg = TRUE) #> model { #>   for(i in 1:N) { #>    y[i] ~ dnorm(prob[i], tau) #>    prob[i] <- beta0 + beta1*(x[i] - x.bar) #>   } #>   beta0 ~ dnorm(0, 0.01) #>   beta1 ~ dnorm(0, 0.01) #>   tau ~ dnorm(0, 0.01) #> x.bar <- mean(x) #> sigma <- 1/sqrt(tau) #> } #>

text: dist Character string indicating distribution.

title: Distribution parametrization in JAGS — jags_param
code: jags_param("f") #> y[i] ~ df(n, m) #> y <- (x1/sqrt(n))/(x2/sqrt(m)) #>   x1 ~ dchisqr(n) #>   x2 ~ dchisqr(m) #>
